Pag 2 of 4 pages
2. The proper utilization of equipment and supplies provided by UNICEF and MSA to produce triple vaccine (Diphtheria, Tetanus and Pertussis) in quantities sufficient to immunize at least 800,000 children each year. ' The target for production in the first year of operation is 1,500,000 cc., and for the second and subsequent years the target will be 2,000,000 cc.
3. As soon as vaccine becomes available, a mass immunization campaign will be started, and the following groups will be included:
(a) All school children between the ages of six to ten years.
(b) All pre-school children between the ages of 6 months and six years. The two groups are estimated to total 2,400,000 children.
4. The campaign will start in urban areas and then extended as rapidly as possible to rural areas to ultimately cover the whole Province.
5. The vaccine will be issued to school health officers, 349 health stations, 22 health centers and 13 provincial hospitals, and in all cases the children will be immunized by trained personnel free of charge.
6. The total dosage per child will be 1.5 cc. administered in three injections. School children will be immunized in the schools. Pre-school children will be immunized in the provincial hospitals, health centers and health stations, or in schools where this is convenient.
0020
7. The target for immunization of school children will be 80,000 per month (during the school year), and for immunization of pre-school children will be 30,000 per month, although this figure can be raised to 50,000 depending on publicity and the cooperation of the civil authorities. 140.112.213.82
8. The immunization of all children entering the recommended age group (6 months to 10 years), i.e. at 6 months, and their re-immunization with a booster dose of 0.5 cc. at 4 years of age, will be made a permanent feature of the Taiwan province public health services.
9. The cooperating agencies will as far as possible meet the following schedule:
(a) Complete remodelling of the Taiwan Serum Vaccine Laboratory and have it ready for the installation of MSA and UNICEF equipment by May 1, 1953.
(b) Complete delivery and installation of MSA equipment by June 1, 1953
(c) Complete delivery of UNICEF equipment and supplies by September 1, 1953
(d) Complete installation of UNICEF equipment by September 30, 1953
(e) Production of Triple Vaccine to start November 15, 1953
(f) Staff for the mass immunization campaign will be ready by November 15, 1953
(g) The mass immunization campaign will start on December 1, 1953
ARTICLE IV
ADMINISTRATION AND ASSIGNMENT OF RESPONSIBILITY
1. The project will be conducted under the responsibility of the Government with technical adwice of the Organization. The Government will designate the Commissioner of Taiwan Provincial Health Administration to take up the immediate responsibility for the administration of the project, but the Commissioner may delegate responsibility to the Director of the Triple Vaccine Immunization Campaign who will be assigned by Taiwan Provincial Health Administration after the arrival of UNICEF supplies. Academia Historica

2. The proper utilization of equipment and supplies provided by UNICEF and MSA to produce triple vaccine (Diphtheria, Tetanus and Pertussis) in quantities sufficient to immunize at least 800,000 children each year. ' The target for production in the first year of operation is 1,500,000 cc., and for the second and subsequent years the target will be 2,000,000 cc.
3. As soon as vaccine becomes available, a mass immunization campaign will be started, and the following groups will be included:
(a) All school children between the ages of six to ten years.
(b) All pre-school children between the ages of 6 months and six years. The two groups are estimated to total 2,400,000 children.
4. The campaign will start in urban areas and then extended as rapidly as possible to rural areas to ultimately cover the whole Province.

5. The vaccine will be issued to school health officers, 349 health stations, 22 health centers and 13 provincial hospitals, and in all cases the children will be immunized by trained personnel free of charge.

6. The total dosage per child will be 1.5 cc. administered in three injections. School children will be immunized in the schools. Pre-school children will be immunized in the provincial hospitals, health centers and health stations, or in schools where this is convenient.

7. The target for immunization of school children will be 80,000 per month (during the school year), and for immunization of pre-school children will be 30,000 per month, although this figure can be raised to 50,000 depending on publicity and the cooperation of the civil authorities. 140.112.213.82

8. The immunization of all children entering the recommended age group (6 months to 10 years), i.e. at 6 months, and their re-immunization with a booster dose of 0.5 cc. at 4 years of age, will be made a permanent feature of the Taiwan province public health services.
9. The cooperating agencies will as far as possible meet the following schedule:
(a) Complete remodelling of the Taiwan Serum Vaccine Laboratory and have it ready for the installation of MSA and UNICEF equipment by May 1, 1953.
(b) Complete delivery and installation of MSA equipment by June 1, 1953
(c) Complete delivery of UNICEF equipment and supplies by September 1, 1953

(e) Production of Triple Vaccine to start November 15, 1953
(f) Staff for the mass immunization campaign will be ready by November 15, 1953
(g) The mass immunization campaign will start on December 1, 1953
ARTICLE IV
ADMINISTRATION AND ASSIGNMENT OF RESPONSIBILITY

1. The project will be conducted under the responsibility of the Government with technical adwice of the Organization. The Government will designate the Commissioner of Taiwan Provincial Health Administration to take up the immediate responsibility for the administration of the project, but the Commissioner may delegate responsibility to the Director of the Triple Vaccine Immunization Campaign who will be assigned by Taiwan Provincial Health Administration after the arrival of UNICEF supplies.
